com.psddev.dari.db

Class Modification<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.psddev.dari.db.Record
      • com.psddev.dari.db.Modification<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Recordable, HtmlObject, Cloneable, Comparable<Record>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CachingDatabase.QueryOptions

    public abstract class Modification<T>
extends Record
    Modifies the object type definitions that are compatible with T. This is most often used to apply a common set of fields and behaviors to a group of classes. It can also be used to do that to an existing class that you can't change.

    For example, let's say you have a news site with articles, galleries, and videos: 

    class Article extends Record { ... }
class Gallery extends Record { ... }
class Video extends Record { ... }

    You can add ratings to all of them and any future types: 

    class Rating extends Modification<Object> {
    private int likes;
    private int dislikes;

    // Getters & Setters.
}

    And access the ratings data through State.as(java.lang.Class<T>): 

    Article article = Query.from(Article.class).first();
article.as(Rating.class).setLikes(10);
article.save();

// Some time later...
article.as(Rating.class).getLikes(); // Returns 10.

    If you don't want to apply the modification to everything, You can limit the effect through either T or Modification.Classes: 

    // Only modifies the Article class.
class Rating extends Modification<Article> { ... }

// Modifies the Gallery and Video classes.
@Modification.classes({ Gallery.class, Video.class })
class Rating extends Modification<Object> { ... }
